arts.ttl: Carlos Corberan upset at West Brom 'risk' after vital Hull City win
arts.sum: As pleased as he was with West Brom ’s 2-1 victory at Hull City, Albion boss Carlos Corberan hit out at the scheduling that saw his team play on Thursday night and then again on Sunday afternoon. “We arrived to this game in a very difficult physical challenge because we played Thursday night,” he said.

arts.ttl: Tim Walter's 'repeat button' verdict after Hull City defeat leaves them on cusp of relegation zone
arts.sum: Tim Walter praised both the Hull City players and their supporters despite watching his side succumb to a 2-1 defeat to West Brom at the MKM Stadium on Sunday afternoon. "In the end, it's more about the performance as we played, but in the end, we don't have the luck at the moment," a frustrated Walter told Hull Live.

arts.ttl: Hull booed off after West Brom loss extends winless run to seven games
arts.sum: Tim Walter's position as Hull head coach was questioned by factions of supporters following a 2-1 home defeat against West Brom.

arts.ttl: Pressure cranked up on Tim Walter as Hull City beaten by West Brom
arts.sum: Albion should have made it three when City fluffed up the chance of clearing but from a tight angle, Maja couldn't finish after Jones did well to recover, and that miss proved costly because, within a couple of minutes, the Tigers hauled themselves back into the game just before the break when Pedro powered in a header from Hughes' cross off the right to give them hope going into the second period. Corberan made a double change after just 53 minutes, with Maja and Fellows replaced by Diangana and Lewis Dobbin after 53 minutes, moments before Callum Styles became the second Baggies player booked for a late challenge after skipper Furlong in the first half.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs West Brom as Tigers beaten again
arts.sum: Joao Pedro headed City back into it just before the break after a fine Charlie Hughes cross to give the Tigers and their supporters hope in the second, but aside from a Regan Slater header, rarely looked like pulling level. Lewie Coyle: Couldn't quite get close enough to Karlan Grant for the opening goal, looked bright going forward and almost scored early in the second half.

arts.ttl: Hull booed off after home loss to West Brom as pressure increases on Tim Walter
arts.sum: The Tigers are now without a win in seven games after first-half goals from Karlan Grant and Josh Maja earned West Brom victory.

arts.ttl: Hull City vs West Brom LIVE match updates and analysis from MKM Stadium
arts.sum: Cardiff City 1-3 Blackburn Rovers That point for Plymouth at Derby means City drop a place to 19th and still outside the drop zone on goal difference after both Cardiff City and Luton Town were beaten.

arts.ttl: Tim Walter shares his big Hull City hope and assesses West Brom challenge
arts.sum: But Walter has stressed it is a game his players will be determined to win and he hopes for a little bit of luck to go their way. That hasn't happened, with Walter retaining the backing of owner Acun Ilicali, despite a dismal start to the season with just three wins in the opening 14 games, including an early Carabao Cup exit at the hands of Sheffield Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Tim Walter's stay of execution at Hull City must spark upturn in fortunes
arts.sum: That hasn't happened yet, and while the Championship can be unpredictable, especially going into the final international break of the calendar year, which is often peak sacking time for nervous club owners with the pivotal Christmas period and then the January transfer window just around the corner, Ilicali remains determined to see Walter turn things around. Against a backdrop of significant anger from supporters after last Saturday's dismal 1-1 draw with Portsmouth, Walter's relationship with City supporters hit the depths on Tuesday when he was heckled throughout the second half of the 1-0 loss against Oxford United amid calls for him to be sacked.

arts.ttl: Hull vs West Brom predictions: Baggies may be set for yet another draw
arts.sum: Wins and goals have been hard to come by for both Hull and West Brom of late and Phil Agius expects the two teams to share the spoils on Sunday.
